greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If A269162(n) = 0, then a(n) = n, otherwise a(n) = a(A269162(n)).
comment: a(n) is the earliest finite ancestor pattern n in Rule-30 or n itself if n has no finite predecessors.
Starting from k = a(n) with any n and iterating map k -> A269160(k) exactly A269166(n) times yields n back.
Apart from zero no terms of A269163 occur so all terms after zero are in A269164. Each term of A269164 occurs an infinitely many times.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..32767
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
formula: If A269162(n) = 0, then a(n) = n, otherwise a(n) = a(A269162(n)).
program: ;; This implementation is based on given recurrence and utilitizes the memoization-macro definec:
;; This one computes the same with tail-recursive iteration:
(define (A269165 n) (let loop ((n n) (p (A269162 n))) (if (zero? p) n (loop p (A269162 p)))))
xref: Cf. A269160, A269163, A269164, A269166 (for a distance in A269162-steps to the ancestor pattern).
Cf. A110240 (indices of ones in this sequence).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 21 2016
